___dockerFile.description: The location of the Dockerfile that defines the contents of the container. The path is relative to the folder containing the `devcontainer.json` file.

___context.description: The location of the context folder for building the Docker image. The path is relative to the folder containing the `devcontainer.json` file.

___image.description: The docker image that will be used to create the container.

___overrideCommand.description: Whether to overwrite the command specified in the image. The default is true.

___appPort.description: Application ports that are exposed by the container. This can be a single port or an array of ports. Each port can be a number or a string. A number is mapped to the same port on the host. A string is passed to Docker unchanged and can be used to map ports differently, e.g. "8000:8010".

___workspaceFolder.description: The path of the workspace folder inside the container.

___shutdownAction.description: Action to take when VS Code is shutting down. The default is to stop the container.

___workspaceMount.description: The --mount parameter for docker run. The default is to mount the project folder at /workspaces/$project.

___runArgs.description: The arguments required when starting in the container.

___workspaceFolder.description: The path of the workspace folder inside the container.

___runServices.description: An array of services that should be started and stopped.

___dockerComposeFile.description: The name of the docker-compose file(s) used to start the services.

___shutdownAction.description: Action to take when VS Code is shutting down. The default is to stop the containers.

___service.description: The service you want to work on.

___name.description: A name to show for the workspace folder.

___extensions.description: An array of extensions that should be installed into the container.

___devPort.description: The port VS Code can use to connect to its backend.

___settings.description: Machine specific settings that should be copied into the container.
